chapter.title: API Entry Point
chapter.para: Users of the API should begin by issuing a GET request on the entry point URI (consisting of {host} and {base}).

note.para: For simplicity, in all other examples we omit the Host request header and assume {base} is /.

chapter.para:
The Link header
The Internet-Draft describing the format of the Link header is available at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-nottingham-http-link-header-10.
and the link elements in the response provides the client with URIs for all of the resource collections exposed by the API. Each collection is identified by a relation type which the client must use to find the URI it needs. The following relation types are available:
capabilities Information about the supported capabilities of RHEV-M
clusters Host clusters
datacenters Data centers
hosts Hosts
networks Virtual networks
storagedomains Storage domains
templates Templates
vmpools Virtual machine pools
vms Virtual machines

note.title: URIs
note.para: All URIs shown in example responses are purely illustrative. The format of all URIs returned by the server is opaque and may change in future versions. Clients must navigate to any specific resources via the entry point URI.

Also, any relative URIs returned by the server are relative to {base}. The server may choose to return absolute or relative URIs and clients should be prepared to handle both. Link headers will only contain absolute URIs.

chapter.para:
In addition to the literal URIs described above, the Link header also contains a set of URI templates
The Internet-Draft describing the format of a URI Template is available at http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-gregorio-uritemplate-03.
which describe the form of URI to be used for querying the collections. Each URI template is identified by a relation type, named according to the convention "collection/search".

note.title: URI Templates
note.para: The purpose of the URI template is allow a search be expressed using the natural HTTP idiom of a query parameter, but without requiring that the client is aware a priori of the URI structure. Thus clients should treat these templates as being opaque, and instantiate them via a URI template library such as the Google Code uri-templates Python package or the Apache Abdera support for Java templates.

chapter.para:
The following relation types are associated with query URI templates:
clusters/search Query host clusters
datacenters/search Query data centers
hosts/search Query hosts
storagedomains/search Query storage domains
templates/search Query templates
vmpools/search Query virtual machine pools
vms/search Query virtual machines
